A

object represents a single distinct maneuver along a route and the approach to the next maneuver. The route step object corresponds to a single instruction the user must follow to complete a portion of the route. For example, a step might require the user to turn then follow a road.

A
object provides you with optimal directions between different locations, or waypoints. The directions object passes your request to the
and returns the requested information to a closure (block) that you provide. A directions object can handle multiple simultaneous requests. A
object specifies criteria for the results, such as intermediate waypoints, a mode of transportation, or the level of detail to be returned.
Options determining the primary mode of transportation for the routes.

indicates the level of traffic congestion along a road segment relative to the normal flow of traffic along that segment. You can color-code a route line according to the congestion level along each segment of the route.

A road sign design standard.
A
object defines a single leg of a route between two waypoints. If the overall route has only two waypoints, it has a single

object that covers the entire route. The route leg object includes information about the leg, such as its name, distance, and expected travel time. Depending on the criteria used to calculate the route, the route leg object may also include detailed turn-by-turn instructions.

A

object indicates a location along a route. It may be the route’s origin or destination, or it may be another location that the route visits. A waypoint object indicates the location’s geographic location along with other optional information, such as a name or the user’s direction approaching the waypoint. You create a
object using waypoint objects and also receive waypoint objects in the completion handler of the
method.

The contents of a banner that should be displayed as added visual guidance for a route. The banner instructions are children of the steps during which they should be displayed, but they refer to the maneuver in the following step.

Computes areas that are reachable within a specified amount of time or distance from a location, and returns the reachable regions as contours of polygons or lines that you can display on a map.
is the level of traffic congestion along a road segment in numeric form, from 0-100. A value of 0 indicates no congestion, a value of 100 indicates maximum congestion.
A
enum represents the weight given to a specific
by the Directions API. The default metric is a compound index called “routability”, which is duration-based with additional penalties for less desirable maneuvers.

to choose an appropriate visual or voice prompt to present the user.

specifies the mode of transportation used for part of a route.
A

object defines a single route that the user can follow to visit a series of waypoints in order. The route object includes information about the route, such as its distance and expected travel time. Depending on the criteria used to calculate the route, the route object may also include detailed turn-by-turn instructions.
